thread.title: Golden Globes red carpet: Top trends from 2017
thread.title_full: Golden Globes red carpet: Top trends from 2017 - TODAY.com

author: Emily Sher
title: Golden Globes red carpet: Top trends from 2017
text:
The red carpet at the 2017 Golden Globes was chock full of gorgeous gowns, sleek suits and down-to-there necklines. But which trends reigned supreme?
TODAY Style gathered eight of the hottest trends from the night, from florals to shoulder pads (yes, you read that right).
RELATED: See the best-dressed stars on the Golden Globes red carpet 2017
Shoulder pads have returned ... AP, Reuters From left: Chrissy Metz, Sarah Paulson, Meryl Streep Who would've guessed that 2017 would mark the return of shoulder pads? But as huge stars like Meryl Streep, Sarah Paulson and newcomer Chrissy Metz prove, the glam '80s fashion can certainly feel modern.
.. but bare shoulders are still big. Reuters, Getty Images, AP From left: Michelle Williams, Thandie Newton, Jenna Bush Hager, Hailee Steinfeld, Goldie Hawn, Sarah Jessica Parker The off-the-shoulder look dominated 2016 — and doesn't seem to be going anywhere.
Suits and tuxes are sleek for women ... Reuters, Getty Images From left: Octavia Spencer, Evan Rachel Wood, Kathryn Hahn As Evan Rachel Wood so eloquently put it, "I wanted to make sure young girls and women know that it's not a requirement." Octavia Spencer and Kathryn Hahn also got into the menswear-inspired look ... and we're sure they felt comfortable wearing pants throughout the night.
RELATED: Evan Rachel Wood reveals why she sported a tux at the Golden Globes
... but girly bows are also beautiful. Reuters, Getty Images, AP From left: Zoe Saldana, Michelle Williams, Felicity Jones Whether around the waist, like Zoe Saldana and Felicity Jones, or tied around the neck, like Michelle Williams, bows look like they'll be big in 2017.
More Style videos 5:50 Ambush Makeover stuns newlywed’s friends (along with Grover and Abby Cadabby) 1:04 Matt Lauer's fashion choker goes viral, causes controversy 1:15 New wedding ring imprints 'married' on wearer’s finger: Cheaters beware! 4:26 Stay warm and fashionable this winter: Plaid robes, faux-fur throws, and more Sunny yellow lit up the red carpet ... Getty Images, AP, EPA From left: Maisie Williams, Reese Witherspoon, Emily Ratajkowski, Viola Davis, Natalie Portman These not-so-mellow yellows made big statements on the red carpet, no matter their shape or silhouette.
... and sprouted flowers and florals galore. AP, Getty Images From left: Connie Britton, Lola Kirke, Jessica Chastain, Olivia Culpo, Busy Phillips Everything's coming up roses (and daisies and blossoms) for these fresh-faced stars. Blooms of all sorts sprouted on gowns and dresses on the red carpet.
AP, Reuters, Getty Images From left: Laura Dern, Jessica Biel, Giuliana Rancic, Lily Collins, Carrie Underwood Angelic and airy gowns floated through the night ... Reuters, AP, AFP-Getty Images From left: Millie Bobby Brown, Drew Barrymore, Nicole Kidman, Tracee Ellis Ross, Emma Stone With tufts of tulle and sheer swaths of fabric, these angelic dresses looked as light as clouds.
RELATED: What you didn't see on TV: Stars share behind-the-scenes Golden Globes pics
... while structural necklines made a statement. AP, AFP - Getty Images, Getty Im From left: Regina King, Amy Adams, Riley Keough, Anna Kendrick, Felicity Jones, Angela Bassett These stars know that small details can make all the difference, and that's definitely true when it comes to necklines. Whether it's Regina King's asymmetrical strapless top or Felicity Jones' cartoon-like ruffles, these gowns
